header.title: Liber 83 Companion: Goodnight All! Personal & Confidential - The Arcane Discipline of The International College of Esoteric Studies, Order of the Grail, Eighth Degree
authors: The International College of Esoteric Studies Inc.

central_thesis: The central thesis is the attainment of the 'God-Man' state through the 'Law of Permutation,' a process of internal spiritual transformation that unifies the human soul with its Divine Soul and Immortal Spirit. This path, rooted in ancient Gnosis and the Pleroma's teachings, transcends conventional religious and occult dogma, emphasizing direct experience, self-mastery, and the realization of humanity's inherent divine nature as a 'Microcosmos' mirroring the 'Macrocosmos.' It requires a 'strict discipline' of mental clarity and active internal work, rather than external rituals or intellectual accumulation, to manifest 'Dynamic Soul-Powers' and achieve mystical enlightenment.

structure_content.summary: This section introduces the 'Law of Permutation' as crucial for understanding 'Hierarchy,' portraying the individual as a link in a chain of 'Whole Consciousness.' It defines 'ecstasy' as a real, vital experience within daily life, not just meditation. The path involves diligently balancing human and divine nature to achieve 'peaceful and satisfying' life. It asserts the inherent 'DIVINE NATURE OF MAN,' where every man is 'potentially a god.' The process is distinguished from other traditions, originating from the 'Immortal Spirit of Richard, Duc de Palatine,' stressing personal proof over dogma. Two stages for 'complete union' are outlined: 'Illumination or Ecstasy' (human Soul unified with Divine Twin) and the Divine Soul conquering the 'Dragon of the lower self.' This is achieved by transcending 'pre-conceived ideas and conceptional sensory-intellectual knowledge' to become a 'God-like Man' by allowing the Immortal Spirit to descend.

Illumination is presented as either the absorption of the human Soul into the Divine or the merging of the Divine with the human. It is not achieved through 'easy' occult dogmas, but through becoming 'fully human,' blending 'Divine and Moral Law,' and mastering the physical body. The text rejects external redemption, arguing that 'no redemption outside the confines of this mortal body' exists, making 'reincarnation and karma' purposeful. Karma is defined by motive rather than action, and its remission is necessary for the Immortal Son to descend. The process involves transmuting 'evil forces' into 'spiritual energies' to clear the 'Shining Cord,' allowing the human Soul to 'escape into the Divine' and later for the Soul consciousness to descend into the human Soul. This requires clearing the mind of all knowledge to become a 'clear concave mirror' and harnessing the subconscious with 'spiritual will.' The final stage is the Immortal Spirit conquering both Divine and human Souls within the mortal body, resulting in the 'God-Man' state.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Divine Plan: Trinity, Emanations, and Kabbalah (Part 5)
structure_content.summary: God manifests as a Trinity of Modes/Aspects, mirrored in man as a Trinity of spirit, soul, and body, each with three vestures. The 'Life of God' pervades all existence, with human consciousness being 'God encased in matter.' God causes seven emanations through the Holy Spirit, forming distinct 'regions or types of matter': divine, spiritual, monadic (forming the Immortal Spirit); Christ level and higher mental (second aspect of the Monadic); lower mental, emotional, vital, and physical. This process is paralleled with the Jewish Kabbalah's ten Sephiroths (Kether, Chokmah, Binah for the Deity; Chesed, Geburah, Tiphereth for the Immortal Spirit; Netzach, Jesod, Hod, Mulkuth for the human aspects). The Divine Plan culminates in the Spirit embodying God's Will, the Divine Soul as the Son, and the human Soul as the Holy Ghost, all essentially 'ONE.' Elevating the human Soul to the Christ-Soul, then to the Immortal Spirit, enables one to become a 'Mediator of the fulfilment of the Law of Permutation.'

structure_content.chapter_title: Permutation vs. Reincarnation & Critiques of Other Systems (Part 6)
structure_content.summary: The text clarifies that 'permutation' is not standard 'reincarnation,' but rather a variation involving the addition of the Immortal Spirit to the Soul, leading to a 'God-incarnate' state. It critiques other Theosophical writers (Leadbeater, Besant) for misinterpreting this doctrine, leading to 'sterile and misleading' systems, and contrasts them with 'Helena Petrovna Blavatsky.' It reinterprets Job's 'wanderer' as the Immortal Spirit's descent, not simple reincarnation, enabling souls to be freed from 'metempsychosis' through remission of karma. It corrects the 'misunderstanding' of 'soul,' positing two souls in man – Divine and human – as aspects of the Ego, termed 'Twins' or 'Christ and Jesus.' This union is exemplified by Christ's entry into Jesus at Baptism and the Spirit's illumination at Transfiguration, revealing the Divine and human Souls of the 'Whole Man.'

structure_content.chapter_title: The Nature of Great Souls, Masters, and Self-Image (Part 7, The Arcane Discipline letter, Part 3)
structure_content.summary: The doctrine illuminates 'great Souls' like Jeshu (Jesus), who Gnostics believed suffered spiritually, not physically, as 'Docetae' or 'Illusionists.' Such Souls, originating from Spirit, are 'imprisoned in the darkness of the flesh' and ascend back through the 'Saviour or Immortal Spirit.' Examples like Jacob Boehme, Paracelsus, and H.P. Blavatsky are cited as allowing Divine Spirits to overshadow them, enabling them to complete human evolution and become 'Demi-Gods.' The text asserts that Masters, though advanced, are not infallible. The 'Arcane Discipline' demands a 'strict discipline' for initiates, emphasizing overcoming lower nature over many incarnations. It states that human suffering persists until the Divine aspect gains control, highlighting the quest to be 'gods' or 'channels' for God and experience the 'fulness of the Godhead bodily.' To understand the 'Philosophy of Naughting,' one must cease 'thinking in mental concepts,' still senses and reason, allowing the 'Voice of the Soul-Self' to impress the brain, directly influencing the 'self-image' (akin to Psycho-Cybernetics) which is an 'inverted reflection of the Abstract Self' and controls personality, emotions, and physical form. The innate 'Success Mechanism' is identified with the 'Divine Soul of the Mystic' or 'Creative Mechanism,' activated by clearing the mind of conceptual images.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Abstract World, True Knowledge, and Practitioner Integrity (Part 4, 5, 6)
structure_content.summary: The document posits that the 'Abstract World' is the source of all 'great truths' and 'mathematical truths,' accessible when senses and reason are quiescent. It critiques conventional psychology's shift to 'self-image' (blueprint), aligning it with Mysticism's 'Philosophy of Naughting.' It champions the Pleroma as the unique public body teaching 'vital secrets of Gnosis' and Esoteric Doctrine. The text emphasizes that true 'Illumination' and 'Ecstasy' are 'not a matter of escape, of getting into the Kingdom of Heaven' but rather an internal conquest of the lower self by the Divine Soul. It criticizes those who seek 'carrot-money' or 'carrot-salvation' in spiritual pursuits and warns against judging by appearances or falling for 'barefaced lies' about quick powers. The importance of 'moral and practical aspects' over mere intellectual knowledge is stressed, noting that even Richard, the transmitter, had to overcome past failures on this path. It advocates 'knowing' over 'feeling' for truth, as 'TRUTH IS ALWAYS SIMPLE' and not cloaked in mystique. The Pleroma integrates Gnostic, Kabbalistic, and modern psychological concepts into a coherent system for internal spiritual transformation, advocating a progressive path of self-mastery and union with the divine within.

key_concepts.definition: The fundamental esoteric principle for spiritual advancement, distinct from common reincarnation, which leads to the 'God-like Man' state by facilitating the alignment, descent, and eventual union of the human, Divine, and Immortal Souls within the individual.
The sum total of Consciousness in relation to the Individual, where the Individual serves as a link in this chain, connected to the 'Whole Consciousness' by Divine Will.

A real and vital experience of transcendental awareness and higher consciousness, attainable while performing the 'normal chores of living,' not exclusively during formal meditation or as a 'transcendental phantasy.'
The first major stage of achieving 'complete union,' where the human Soul becomes unified with its 'Divine Twin' (the Divine Soul), leading to a state of profound spiritual insight.
The inherent god-like potential and reality within every human being, asserting that 'AT ROOT HE IS GOD' and that man is a 'Microcosmos' containing all the attributes of the divine 'Parent Source.'

The highest aspect of the individual's Self, representing a direct emanation of the 'Unknown God,' whose descent into the human tabernacle is the culmination of spiritual advancement through the Law of Permutation.
Referred to as the 'Son of God' and the 'Divine Twin' of the human soul. It is the intermediate aspect that the human soul strives to unify with as a precursor to union with the Immortal Spirit.

The aspect of man that is in a state of 'negation' and suffering until the Divine aspect gains control. Its upliftment and unification with the Divine Soul and Immortal Spirit are central to the path of 'complete union.'

An energetic link, likened to a 'funnel of shining light,' that descends from 'the Father' through the Spirit and Soul, connecting to the human soul and carrying 'three centres of energy' essential for spiritual connection and influence.

Direct, intuitive knowledge or inner wisdom concerning esoteric truths, distinct from intellectual, sensory, or conceptual understanding. It forms the foundation of the 'Traditional Esoteric Arcaria' taught by the College.

In this context, it refers to the 'fullness' of esoteric knowledge and specifically to the 'International College of Esoteric Studies' as the public body 'propounding the vital secrets of the Gnosis and the Esoteric Doctrine of the Ages.'

A meditative and mental discipline requiring one to 'stop thinking in mental concepts,' cause the senses and reason to 'remain still and passive,' allowing 'the Voice of the Soul-Self to impress the brain cells with its Power' from the stillness of the self-image.

The internal 'blueprint' or 'mind picture' of oneself, understood as an 'inverted reflection of the Abstract Self within molecular matter.' Changing this self-image is crucial for transforming personality, physical form, emotional nature, and mental outlook.

Identified with the 'Divine Soul of the Mystic' or 'Creative Mechanism' inherent in human nature. It works automatically to achieve goals of success and happiness when the mind is cleared of 'conceptional images' and aligned with this inner drive.
The effect of human 'motive' rather than merely action. Its remission, achieved through 'personal effort,' is necessary for the Immortal Son to descend and free souls from 'metempsychosis.'

practical_system.description: The system outlines a 'strict discipline' for internal spiritual transformation, aiming for the 'God-Man' state through the 'Law of Permutation.' It is a progressive path involving the conscious unification of the human, Divine, and Immortal Souls. Practitioners must diligently balance their human and divine attributes, achieving mental clarity by 'naughting' conceptual thoughts and stilling the senses and reason to allow the 'Voice of the Soul-Self' to impress the brain. This 'Philosophy of Naughting' is key to transforming the 'self-image' (the internal blueprint) to align with the 'Abstract Self,' thereby activating the 'Success Mechanism' (Divine Soul). The practice involves actively transmuting 'evil forces' into 'spiritual energies' to clear the 'Shining Cord,' which facilitates the descent of higher consciousness and allows the individual to become a 'Mediator' and a channel for the divine. The emphasis is on direct, experiential knowledge and practical self-mastery within the 'mortal body' rather than external rituals or dogmatic adherence.
tools: Self-observation and introspection (maintaining a watch on attitudes, freeing from 'hang-ups')
Philosophy of Naughting (stopping mental concepts, stilling senses and reason to access Soul-Self)
Internal discipline (balancing human/divine attributes, clearing mind of 'all knowledge' to become a 'clear concave mirror')
Transmutation of 'evil forces' into 'spiritual energies' (to clear the 'Shining Cord')
Consciousness focus (keeping consciousness 'focussed in the body' for mastery)
Self-image transformation (changing internal blueprint per Psycho-Cybernetics to align with Abstract Self)

relevant_quotes.text: The International College of Esoteric Studies Inc., is a registered non-profit institution and exists for the purpose of disseminating information on the Traditional Esoteric Arcaria. ... This Liber is loaned, not sold, to the receiving member as an incident of membership, for personal and private study, and its acceptance by the student is an acknowledgement that it is being held in trust for the College and is to be returned to it upon request.
To sum the whole process up means that all we need to do is to stop ourselves asking too many questions about life and just be a natural and loving human being.

Thus the Root Teaching of this Wisdom at all times has been the DIVINE NATURE OF MAN; and what was taught in the inner schools of the Mysteries - a teaching which can still be obtained - was the method of achieving this supreme knowledge in a practical manner, that is to say the attainment of God-like characters and powers. Every man is potentially a god, AT ROOT HE IS GOD....Knowledge is Power.
The expression "Ye are Gods", which, to our biblical and modern students is a mere abstraction, is for the Gnostic of vital significance and more so for the student of the Pleromic Life.

There are two stages to be passed through in order to attain this complete union, first, one must attain Illumination or Ecstasy, which means that the human Soul must become unified with its Divine Twin - the Divine Soul.
There is no redemption outside the confines of this mortal body of yours, hence the purpose of reincarnation and karma.
The Master can only give you advice and encouragement, but he cannot, nor is he permitted to, stand between you and your God within.
The Law must be fulfilled in the whole of Man becoming a GOD-MAN on earth.

To understand this Philosophy of Naughting one must of necessity stop thinking in mental concepts, those pictures which the mind creates when one thinks of a thing, we must cause the senses to remain still and passive. By this means the reason is also silenced, then in the stillness of the - self-image, the Voice of the Soul-Self can impress the brain cells with its Power.
The Pleroma is the only public body propounding the vital secrets of the Gnosis and the Esoteric Doctrine of the Ages in a form which can be applied by the modern seeker.

critical_analysis.relevance: This document is highly relevant for practitioners and academics in Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in Gnostic-Hermetic traditions, Christian Esotericism, and systems advocating individual deification. It offers a unique synthesis that integrates concepts from Kabbalah, ancient mysteries, and even modern Psycho-Cybernetics into a cohesive framework for spiritual evolution. Its emphasis on internal, experiential transformation, distinct from external dogma or superficial practices, positions it as a challenging yet potentially profound guide for advanced students. It critically engages with common misunderstandings of concepts like reincarnation and the role of 'Masters,' urging direct engagement with one's 'God within.' The text's focus on personal responsibility and the practical application of esoteric theory for holistic human development makes it a valuable contribution to the discourse on operative mysticism.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists of dedicated initiates and serious students of 'The International College of Esoteric Studies' and its 'Order of the Grail,' who are prepared for 'personal and private study' of advanced esoteric 'Arcaria.' It assumes a foundational understanding of esoteric concepts and is clearly not intended for beginners. The document explicitly warns against 'pseudo-leaders' and superficial promises, emphasizing that the path requires deep self-work, 'strict discipline,' and a willingness to challenge pre-conceived notions. It is aimed at individuals seeking a profound, internal, and often arduous journey towards becoming a 'God-Man,' rather than those looking for easy 'carrot-money' or 'carrot-salvation' in spiritual pursuits.
